title: Exclude address saving from specific websites
content: Hi. I'm an admin using web based school class scheduling software. I have to go into student and instructor records frequently where their personal info is displayed in the form of filled in fields on a web page. Every time I exit a student/instructor contact page, firefox asks me if I want to save their addresses. Obviously I don't want to do this with other peoples info, but I'd still like to autofill addresses for my own private browsing. Is there a way I can exclude only the class scheduling website from address autofill/autosave without shutting the function off entirely for all my other browsing? Thanks .
creator: bengreen1935

title: IHG.com not working again
content:
Similar to this thread: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1437649

At the time removing the enhanced protection worked. Now not able to login to the site again. It goes to login, and then results in me not being logged in and asking for credentials again.

I've turned off all my ad blockers & privacy extensions for this domain (Disconnect, uBlock Origin, decentraleyes, cookie auto-delete, clearurls) as welll as having enhanced protection off.

Still doesn't work on Firefox, but fine on other browsers
creator: rwps

title: Secure Connection Failed
content:
After years of using Firefox and accessing my grocery store online for the weekly ad and specials it suddenly says shows me this when I try to open the website:

Secure Connection Failed

An error occurred during a connection to www.dillons.com. 

   The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified.    Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem.

When I look for solutions it tells me there is no way to allow this website to open now. What is going on? I don't care if it's a secure connection, it's just a grocery store ad.
creator: srlatham8

title: How to keep FF from closing when closing last tab?
content:
howdy y'all,

ff = 128.03 os = win11 extensions = problem still there when all off

when i close the last tab ... firefox closes. [*sigh*] way back when [several years ago], i could close all the tabs quickly and still have FF open and ready to go to my next site.

how can i get FF to behave as i want? [*grin*]

take care, rld
